text:
Chief Complaint:  Severe abdominal pain
   HPI:
   44 yr with recent diagnosis of mullerian adenocarcinoma presented to
   [**Hospital1 54**] ER on [**2165-7-16**] with severe abdominal pain and vomiting. CT scan
   revealed large pelvic mass with peritoneal spread and high grade small
   bowel obstruction.
   Pt underwent ultrasound guided drainage. cytology final report from the
   ultrasound guided drainage showed neoplastic cells consistent with
   mullerian adenocarcinoma. CT scan and MRI demonstrated extensive
   disease.
   Patient underwent TAH BSO with small bowel and sigmoid resection and
   omentectomy [**7-18**]  and intermittently required neo gtt. remained
   intubated post op for airway protection r/t large doses of narcotics
   given.
   Tachycardia, Other
   Assessment:
   ST 120s-130s  BP 100s-110s, cvp 3-5, tmax 99.3
   Action:
   Sedation increased, fent@125 and versed26. 500cc LR bolus x2 and 1L LR
   bolusx1 given, EKG done,
   D-Dimer sent.
   Response:
   Remains tachy, BP stable, cvp 8-10, pt sedated and appears comfortable.
   Plan:
   Cont to monitor, ?PE
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Sedated on arrival to MICU, pt alert and nodding yes to pain, pain
   controlled w/ boluses on fent and versed.
   Action:
   Pt cont to be uncomfortable and becoming tachy, versed and fent gtts
   started.
   Response:
   Pt sedated and comfortable, remains tachy.
   Plan:
   Cont gtts, wean as tolerated.
   Airway, Inability to Protect (Risk for Aspiration, Altered Gag, Airway
   Clearance, Cough)
   Assessment:
   Large doses of narcotics given in surgery, remains intubated for airway
   protection.
   Action:
   Current vent setting CMV/40%/450/14/5
   Response:
   O2 sat 98-100%, 7.37/34/146
   Plan:
   Monitor O2 sat, extuabte when stable.
   Neuro: sedated, opens eyes to pain. Hypotermic on arrival, bair hugger
   on pt. current temp 99.3ax. fent and versed gtts for sedation and pain
   control.
   Resp: remains intubated for airway protection. LSC, O2 sat 98-100%.
   CV: ST 120s-130s, no ectopy noted, BP 110s.
   GI/GU: abdominal incision, drsng C/D/I.
BS, NGT to low wall suction,
   no outpt. Foley patent and draining yellow urine, approx 50cc/hr.
   Access: R TL IJ, R aline.
